original_title: Minister’s response over 12 hour daily working shift
original_body_lines: Labour Minister Manusha Nanayakkara denied some trade union allegations that the government is planning to introduce a four day working week and to increase the current daily working shift to 12 hours from eight hours.
"The remarks made by trade unions are misleading. We have started public consultations, after that we have to draft a proposal," the minister told the Daily Mirror.

Earlier the Joint Secretary of the Free Trade Zone Workers' Joint Trade Union, Anton Marcus alleged that the government is planning to introduce a four day working week with three day weekend holidays and introduce a 12 hour daily working shift instead of the eight hour shift which is the current practice.
"Workers will lose the privileges which they are enjoying now with the new move. All workers should get together in preventing this change," he said. (Yohan Perera)
